Step-by-step analysis:

1. Replace every instance of the typedef `c` with the original data type `int`.
2. Replace every instance of the typedef `d` with the original data type `unsigned`.
3. Replace every instance of the typedef `e` with the original data type `short`.
4. Replace every instance of the typedef `f` with the original data type `unsigned`.
5. Remove the typedef declarations since they are no longer used.
6. Replace the variable declaration `static short g = 0x7EBAL;` with `static int g = 0x7EBAL;`.
7. Replace the variable declaration `d h = 0xCAL;` with `unsigned h = 0xCAL;`.
8. Replace the variable declaration `e i;` with `short i;`.
9. Remove the variable declaration `c j[5][5];` since it is unused.
10. Replace the variable declaration `f k = 0xAF7C65D6L;` with `unsigned k = 0xAF7C65D6L;`.
11. Replace the variable declaration `static d l;` with `static unsigned l;`.
12. Replace the variable declaration `f m[9][2][3];` with `unsigned m[9][2][3];`.
13. Replace the variable declaration `c n;` with `int n;`.
14. Replace the function signature `d fn1(signed, short, c, signed);` with `unsigned fn1(signed, short, int, signed);`.
15. Replace the function signature `signed fn2(c);` with `signed fn2(int);`.
16. Replace the function definition `f fn3() { ... }` with `unsigned fn3() { ... }`.
17. Replace the parameter `c p3` in `d fn1(signed p1, short p2, c p3, signed p4)` with `int p3`.
18. Replace the variable declaration `c w = 0x709BFC8AL;` with `int w = 0x709BFC8AL;`.
19. Replace the member access `v[g][l + 1][l]` with `v[g][l + 1][l]`.
20. Replace the member access `j[g][g]` with `j[g][g]`.
21. Replace the function signature `int main() { ... }` with `int main() { ... }`.
